meanings.definition: A person who inoculates against disease.
meanings.sent1: The inoculator gave me a shot to protect me from getting sick.
meanings.sent2: The inoculator at the clinic is very skilled at giving vaccinations.
meanings.sent3: The inoculator joked that getting a shot was like getting a superhero shield against germs.
meanings.sent4: The inoculator's needle was like a tiny sword fighting off the invisible enemy of illness.
meanings.sent5: I will always remember the kind smile of the inoculator who kept me safe from diseases.

meanings.sent1: The inoculator was carefully sterilized before being used on the patient.
meanings.sent2: The laboratory had a high-tech inoculator for precise injections.
meanings.sent3: The inoculator looked like a tiny spaceship ready to launch a protective mission into the body.
meanings.sent4: The inoculator's mechanism hummed softly as it delivered the life-saving vaccine.
meanings.sent5: The shiny metal of the inoculator gleamed under the bright lights of the medical room.
